titles.title: Criminal Justice Coordinating Council Restructuring Act of 2001
Criminal Justice Coordinating Council Restructuring Act of 2001
Criminal Justice Coordinating Council Restructuring Act of 2002

To require certain Federal officials with responsibility for the administration of the criminal justice system of the District of Columbia to serve on and participate in the activities of the District of Columbia Criminal Justice Coordinating Council, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on District of Columbia.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Mrs. Morella moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2305.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Governmental Affairs.
Committee on Governmental Affairs referred to Subcommittee on Oversight of Government Management, Restructuring and the District of Columbia.

calendar.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Lieberman without amendment. With written report No. 107-145.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 362.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.subcommittee: Oversight of Government Management, the Federal Workforce, and the District of Columbia
committee.name: Senate Governmental Affairs

bill.summary: 12/4/2001--Passed House amended. Criminal Justice Coordinating Council Restructuring Act of 2001 - Authorizes the Director of the Court Services and Offender Supervision Agency for the District of Columbia (D.C.), the Director of the D.C. Pretrial Services Agency, the U.S. Attorney for D.C., the Director of the Bureau of Prisons, the Chair of the U.S. Parole Commission, and the Director of the United States Marshals Service to serve on the D.C. Criminal Justice Coordinating Council.Establishes an annual reporting requirement for the Council.Authorizes appropriations for FY 2002 and thereafter for a Federal contribution to D.C. to cover the costs incurred by the Council.
